intro: Carex scoparia f. tenerrima, commonly known as the slender sedges, is a variant of the common sedge species Carex scoparia. It is a perennial plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in wet conditions.
